newsitem.title: UK: N.Ireland Elec to cut home tariffs by 8 pct.
newsitem.headline: N.Ireland Elec to cut home tariffs by 8 pct.

text.p: Northern Ireland Electricity Plc said on Thursday that after a pricing review it had decided to cut prices for domestic customers by at least 8.0 percent from April 1 and make smaller price cuts for bigger industrial and commercial customers.

At the same time, it added in a statement, it will slash its standing charges for domestic customers to 7.94 stg per quarter from 15.20 stg, so that some low consumption customers could see their bills fall by up to 20 percent.
NIE operations director Harry McCracken said in the statement that the move followed a price increase last year of less than the rate of inflation.
"This year, the reduction in prices reflects the substantial efficiency gains NIE has made over the last four years," he added.

The price cuts were being implemented ahead of an expected report from the Monopolies and Mergers Commission (MMC), NIE said, adding that any further adjustments needed would be made in agreement with the industry regulator.
